data.title: Steamed sandwiches! A surprise!
data.text: They steam bagels here which is something I'd never heard of. They also have gluten free bread and I appreciate that since I'm gluten free. This is a small cozy place. It closes around 3 so it's really a breakfast or lunch spot. What we tried was tasty. It's a cute neighborhood spot.

data.title: Pleasant morning Coffee and Breakfast
data.text:
We enjoyed a fine cup of Guatemalan coffee (Americano & regular) plus excellent speciality bagel (eggs+) and fresh pastry.
Sat outside. Friendly, courteous staff.
Enjoy!

data.title: Good Guatemalan Coffee by Bike Shop and Pist Office
data.text:
First time in after passing many times...
The Tugboat Coffee from Guatemala is very good. A nice surprise and liked the the mini cream cheese filled croissants.
Good location, Atmosphere

data.title: Good coffee, nice location
data.text: Nice location (right down the street from the Margarita European Hotel) and really tasty coffee. We weren't too impressed by their bakery and pastry items, but the coffee was worth the visit. Spacious and lots of room set up a laptop and work, or chat with friends/family.

data.title: Good Neighborhood cafe
data.text: Friendly cafe.  Good food but not fast.  Coffees, bagels, sandwiches, waffles.  Close to our hotel so it was especially nice for us.

data.title: Coffee with Liege Waffle(really)
data.text: We were in Evanston for the farmers market on Saturday morning and stopped at the bike shop. I wanted a cup of coffee ms the closet shop just happened to have real Liege waffles. These are real Belgium waffles and are wonderful with the taste of caramelized Suger.  I like mine plain but they do out toppings on them. The shop does coffee drinks and sandwiches and well.

data.title: A darn good bagel sandwich
data.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast.  The bagel sandwiches are made with fresh ingredients and all made to order.  Great to support a local business and easy to support a local business when the food is delicious!

data.title: Tasty breakfast
data.text: We went there for a quick bite and ordered two bagels. It was a bit pricy for breakfast ($10-$12) but they did make a tasty chi latte! Service was pretty good but the food seemed a bit expensive. Good find for a quick breakfast!

data.title: Comfy Local Coffee Place
data.text: Nice to support local places!  It's easy to do at Delbe's   Friendly and comfortable.  Nice new decor.   Nice crowds and not raucous!   Especially nice on Sunday afternoons.  Baked goods are good, but occasionally stale.

data.title: Delightful place!
data.text: Located only a couple of blocks from the Northwestern University campus, this corner eatery has great bagel sandwiches,  coffees, teas, & smoothies. Each sandwich is freshly prepared,  not wrapped up & pulled out of a display case, making them mouth-watering delicious!  Turkey, corned beef, & veggie sandwiches are just a few of their offerings.  I highly recommend this quaint eatery for breakfast or lunch!

data.title: Nice place for Lunch!
data.text: We'd been meaning to try Delbe's so finally walked through the door.  I spoke to the people behind the counter re gluten free options and they were super helpful.  I decided on the "Snook" which is on their all day breakfast menu.  It is wild caught salmon, cream cheese, onions and capers, but rather than doing it on a bagel or as a wrap, they wrapped it in a lettuce leaf for me.  It was sooo good.  My husband decided on the "Black Belt" which is Bacon, gouda, muenster, tomato, mushrooms, avocado and parmesan peppercorn which he had a on a bagel.I think he'll choose something else the next time as he really likes hard cheeses with a kick, but we will be back.

data.title: Great place for breakfast
data.text: I was staying in Evanston and was looking for a good breakfast place and I was glad I found this. Very friendly people and their breakfast was quite delicious. You should definitely try their waffles and sandwiches.

data.title: You have to try a steamed sandwich...you just do!
data.text:
Discovered by chance as people were sitting outside and groaning as to how dee-lish their sandwiches were. I decided to check it out as the window ads talked about "steamed sandwiches".  OMG...warm, fabulous bialy (bread) and the flavors were brilliant.   The owners go out of their way to suggest different combinations.  You can sit in/out. WIFI available.  Husband is Belgian/French and wife is American I believe. Why go to a chain?? Quirky, beyond delicious and fun. 

Get out of your comfort zone and try Delbe's Corner. Great value too.

data.title: Friendly, helpful staff and delicious food - awesome neighborhood coffee shop!
data.text:
Delbe's Corner is the kind of neighborhood coffee shop everyone hopes to have in their 'hood. Fantastic customer service, tasty sandwiches and drinks, local ambiance, and a cozy atmosphere. I really love to support local businesses and this place is the epitome of great local business. Take that, Starbucks!

I discovered Delbe's Corner through Yelp on a visit to Northwestern University, and what a find it was. It's a little ways from the school itself, but it was more than worth the walk in the frigid temperatures. The store is indeed on a corner, with big windows overlooking the street and it just invites you in. The place has a comfy feel, with a combination of tables and some comfy couches and easy chairs. It was also super clean and decorated in a Pac-Man motif, which I thought was pretty cute. If I attended Northwestern, I could definitely see myself studying or bringing a coffee date here. I was the only one in the shop on a cool morning, which worried me a bit at first, but then I realized my nerves were for naught. The owner, Tasha, greeted me warmly and helped me decide what to order, offering to customize things however I wanted. I ended up ordering the Sunrise breakfast sandwich (scrambled egg, bacon, ham, american and pepperjack) and a pumpkin latte. Her husband makes the sandwiches and she's the barista, so it's not a fast, assembly line style operation but the wait is more than worth it. She chatted with me while I waited, and I found out that she was originally from my area, so we got to swap a few stories.  

So the service was wonderful, but how was the food? The breakfast sandwich was just fantastic. It was the steamed bagel sandwich style (love!), which melted the cheese perfectly and made for a delicious, hot breakfast. Instead of an everything bagel, I got it on cinnamon raisin, which was the ideal blend of sweet and savory. Lastly, I have to say the pumpkin latte was a little bitter for my tastes. I was able to customize and tried to sweeten it up with soy milk and cinnamon, but it was still too bitter for me. Oh well - it was warm on a cold morning and it did the trick caffeine wise, which is all I really needed anyway.

I wished I could have made it back for another meal, because the hospitality was just fantastic and the lunch sandwiches sounded equally as tasty. Definitely a find. If you're looking for a great coffee shop around Evanston, this is it!

data.title: Great food, great people
data.text: This place was an amazing "find."  Our B&B, just up the street, had a totally uninspired breakfast buffet, so we went in search of something better and found this great little place - yes, it is on a corner - where we could hang out and have huge cups of all kinds of coffee and tea, along with homemade rolls baked by French-inspired chefs.  On one of the rainiest possible days, we got a huge smile and a cheery "good morning" - the best was to start the day.  The husband-wife team also offered - only when asked - hints about local sights and stores.  And the wife of the team, at our urging, brought out an album of her award-winning furniture designs and told us about some of her "reinventions" of herself.  It's definitely worth a try!
